unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked, "Will robots take over all our jobs?" Lol, that's a big question!
normalised: Okay, so someone asked, "Will robots take over all our jobs?" Laughing out loud, that's a big question!

unnormalised: Seriously though, chill out! Robots aren't suddenly going to be running your chai stall or fixing your auto-rickshaw. Maybe in 2050? But even then, who's gonna argue with a robot about the price of a samosa? AI is getting smarter, sure. My cousin's got this fancy Roomba, model RX-7000, that cleans his flat in Gurgaon. But it still gets stuck on the chappals near the door.
normalised: Seriously though, chill out! Robots aren't suddenly going to be running your chai stall or fixing your auto-rickshaw. Maybe in two thousand fifty? But even then, who's gonna argue with a robot about the price of a samosa? A-I is getting smarter, sure. My cousin's got this fancy Roomba, model R-X-seven thousand, that cleans his flat in Gurgaon. But it still gets stuck on the chappals near the door.

unnormalised: Think about it. We need ppl to build and program these bots. Companies like TCS and Infosys are hiring like crazy! Plus, who’s gonna teach a robot to haggle for the best price at Chandni Chowk? Or understand the nuances of a Bollywood plotline? Try explaining "Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi" to a robot! It would probably short-circuit!
normalised: Think about it. We need people to build and program these bots. Companies like T-C-S and Infosys are hiring like crazy! Plus, who’s gonna teach a robot to haggle for the best price at Chandni Chowk? Or understand the nuances of a Bollywood plotline? Try explaining "Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi" to a robot! It would probably short-circuit!

unnormalised: So, yeah, robotics is the future. But the future also needs a healthy dose of desi common sense and bargaining skills. Don't prepone your retirement plans just yet. You're more valuable than a bunch of circuits and code, at least for the next 25 yrs or so. Peace out!
normalised: So, yeah, robotics is the future. But the future also needs a healthy dose of desi common sense and bargaining skills. Don't prepone your retirement plans just yet. You're more valuable than a bunch of circuits and code, at least for the next twenty five years or so. Peace out!
